senses.de: To do something wrong or illegal.
senses.ex: He was arrested for committing a crime.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: Using 'commit' with negative actions highlights the seriousness or wrongness of the act.
Tips.example: He was accused of committing perjury.

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: Often used in legal or formal contexts when discussing crime or violations.
Tips.example: The jury decided she did commit the offense.

senses.de: To say that you will definitely do something or must do something.
senses.ex: She has committed to finish the project by next week.

Tips.title: Strong Promise
Tips.description: When 'commit' is used with 'to', it expresses a strong intention or obligation.

Tips.title: Formal Agreement
Tips.description: Particularly formal and strong compared to just saying 'I will do it'.
Tips.example: She committed to the contract's terms.

senses.de: To put someone in a hospital because of a mental illness.
senses.ex: Because of his erratic behavior, his family had him committed.

Tips.title: Sensitive Context
Tips.description: Used with care due to the sensitivity of discussing mental health issues.
Tips.example: He voluntarily committed himself for treatment.

senses.de: To involve yourself or give your attention to something.
senses.ex: I can't commit to another project right now.

Tips.title: Resource Allocation
Tips.description: Implies a serious dedication of one's time, effort, or resources to something.
Tips.example: We've committed significant time to this cause.

senses.ex: They committed their secrets to us.

Tips.title: Trust Implication
Tips.description: Suggests a strong trust placed in the person receiving the commitment.
Tips.example: The sensitive task was committed to her care.

senses.de: To perform a particular action in a computer program.
senses.ex: Please commit your changes before leaving.

Tips.title: Tech Usage
Tips.description: Common in technology to describe saving or finalizing changes.
Tips.example: Developers commit code to the repository regularly.

senses.de: To send or direct for treatment.
senses.ex: The doctor committed the patient to a specialist.

Tips.title: Medical Referral
Tips.description: Indicates a professional decision to transfer a patient for specific care.
Tips.example: The general practitioner committed her to a cardiologist.

Consign.wordDefinition:
Consign means to entrust or hand over something to someone else's care. For example, "I will consign this valuable painting to the auction house.".

Commit is used when you are taking responsibility for something while consign is used when you are handing over something to someone else.

Dedicate.wordDefinition: To dedicate means to devote yourself to a particular cause, activity, or person. For instance, you can dedicate your time and effort to volunteering for a charity or dedicate your life to pursuing your dream career.

Deliver.wordDefinition:
Commit means to promise to do something, while deliver means to actually follow through and do it. Committing is only the first step of making a promise, while delivering is completing the promise.

If they say "I will deliver on my promise to clean the dishes tonight," it means they will definitely do it.

Commit is applicable in situations where someone wants to make a promise or indicate their intention to do something. Deliver is applicable when someone wants to convey that they have actually completed the task or promise they committed to.

Devote.wordDefinition: Devote means to give one's time, effort, or attention to a particular activity, cause, or person. It implies a sense of enthusiasm or passion, and can be used in situations like devoting time to a hobby, devoting oneself to a religious practice, or devoting resources to a charitable cause.

Entrust.wordDefinition:
Entrust means to give someone or something important and valuable to take care of, often implying trust in their abilities or judgment.

For example, you might entrust your dog to a pet sitter while you're on vacation, or entrust your friend with a secret.

Commit is used more broadly to refer to any type of obligation or responsibility, while entrust is used specifically for situations where trust is involved.

Hand over.wordDefinition:
Hand over means to give something to someone else, often used when giving possession of something to someone who is more entitled to it or has a right to it.

On the other hand, "He handed over the evidence to the police." This means that the person gave something to the police.

Pledge.wordDefinition:
Pledge also means to make a promise or commitment, but it's often used in situations where there is a sense of loyalty or dedication involved.

For example, you might pledge your allegiance to your country or pledge to do your best to support a friend in need.

Pledge is often used in a more formal setting such as making a pledge to donate money to a charity.

Commit is used when there is a responsibility or obligation involved, while pledge is used when there is a sense of loyalty or dedication involved.

Promise.wordDefinition:
Promise means to make a declaration that you will do or not do something. It implies a sense of assurance to another person or group that you will keep your word, no matter what.

Promise describes statements or commitments made to others. For example, a person could promise to pick up their friend from the airport or promise to be more honest in their relationships.

Overall, while the two words have some overlap, commit typically describes actions and promise typically describes statements or declarations made to others.

quotes.Text: Let us begin by committing ourselves to the truth to see it like it is, and tell it like it is, to find the truth, to speak the truth, and to live the truth.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.Text: Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.
quotes.Title: Greek Author
quotes.Name: Aesop

quotes.Text: All the passions make us commit faults; love makes us commit the most ridiculous ones.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: Saddam has committed many crimes against humanity and against his own people.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Tom Cruise

quotes.Text: One has to be fully committed to one's career. Otherwise, there's no point.
quotes.Title: Indian Musician
quotes.Name: Lata Mangeshkar

quotes.Text: Committing unnecessary surgeries is very, very rare. And it's very wrong.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: H. G. Bissinger

quotes.Text: Mostly, cybercriminals are motivated to commit crime for financial gain.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Frank Abagnale

quotes.Text: If I do something, I commit. Otherwise you spread yourself too thin.

quotes.Name: Holly Willoughby

quotes.Text: Godrej is committed towards improving quality of life in society.

quotes.Text: When you play a character, you commit yourself to their beliefs.

quotes.Name: Jonathan Pryce
